[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Project Management System (PMS) enables efficient management of tasks, resources, and team collaboration to ensure successful project delivery.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: PMS includes features for task creation, resource allocation, team communication, project tracking, and generating progress reports.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: PMS integrates with external tools for task management and syncing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: PMS provides web and mobile apps.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: PMS supports desktops, smartphones, and tablets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: PMS uses secure APIs for communication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: PMS sends notifications via email, SMS, and push notifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: PMS optimizes memory for seamless task management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: PMS tracks project status, assigns tasks, and enables communication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: PMS customizes notifications based on user roles and preferences.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: PMS integrates with calendar, email, and document management systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: PMS enables task creation, resource allocation, team collaboration, project tracking, and reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: PMS serves project managers, team members, resource managers, and stakeholders.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: PMS requires internet for syncing and notifications.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: PMS depends on secure APIs and integrations with management tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Project: Set of tasks with goals.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with external tools for task management, syncing, and scheduling.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall sync task data with third-party project management tools.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall create and assign tasks with deadlines, track task progress, and provide real-time updates (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall notify team members of assigned tasks and updates (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall generate customizable progress reports for task and project tracking (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall allow team members to log time spent on tasks.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive interface for tasks, tracking, and communication.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall sync data in real-time with a maximum latency of 1 second delay.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall generate reports on project status and progress within 2 seconds for up to 10,000 active tasks.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store project and task data securely with encryption.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall be cross-platform compatible on all devices.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall adapt responsively to varying screen sizes.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with GDPR for user data privacy.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall encrypt all data transfers between client and server.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall ensure high availability and minimal downtime.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Test integration, syncing, task assignment, notifications, and report generation.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, system docs, GDPR compliance, and best practices.
[SEC] 5. References: Project management standards, GDPR compliance, and reporting guidelines.
